content.transcript:
Waste must be removed from food rooms regularly to minimize the risk of contaminating food to reduce odour and to avoid the encouragement of pests, especially flies.

For internal use, easy to clean bins with foot-operated lids and disposable plastic liners are preferred.

Internal refuse containers must be emptied regularly throughout the day and always at the end of the day.

Internal refuse containers must be emptied regularly throughout the day and always at the end of the day.

Receptacles used for storage of refuse should not be reused for the storage of food.

Unfit or out-of-date food should be marked and stored in clearly marked containers whilst awaiting collection.

It should be isolated from food intended for use or sale.

page.statement: Waste must be removed from food rooms regularly to:
page.bullet: Minimise the risk of contaminating food
Avoid attracting or breeding pests, especially flies.
Foot operated with disposable plastic liners
Emptied regularly throughout the day and always at the end of the day
Never reused for the storage of food.
page.statement: Unfit/out-of-date food should be clearly identified and stored in clearly marked containers whilst awaiting collection; isolated from food intended for use or sale.

page.statement:
Waste must not be allowed to accumulate in food rooms.

Waste must be deposited in closable containers.
